alert.note: Alert for Blackford; Huntington; Jay; Wabash; Wells (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 5:11AM EST until February 23 at 10:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Salamonie River below Warren affecting Huntington, Wabash, Wells, Blackford and Jay Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Salamonie River below Warren. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, The river reaches flood stage with minor flooding of low agricultural land and roads nearest the river. Belleville Road and East Flowing Well Road northwest of Warren become impassable and isolated nearby residences. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EST Thursday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM EST Thursday was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 7.6 feet by Monday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
